metadata.title: CVE-2021-47343 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: dmbtree remove: assign new_root only when removal succeeds remove_raw() indm_btree_remove() may fail due to IO read error (e.g. read the content oforigin block fails during shadowing), and the value of shadow_spine::rootis uninitialized, but the uninitialized value is still assign to new_rootin the end of dm_btree_remove(). For dm-thin, the value ofpmd->details_root or pmd->root will become an uninitialized value, so iftrying to read details_info tree again out-of-bound memory may occur asshowed below: general protection fault, probably for non-canonical address0x3fdcb14c8d7520 CPU: 4 PID: 515 Comm: dmsetup Not tainted 5.13.0-rc6Hardware name: QEMU Standard PC RIP: 0010:metadata_ll_load_ie+0x14/0x30Call Trace: sm_metadata_count_is_more_than_one+0xb9/0xe0dm_tm_shadow_block+0x52/0x1c0 shadow_step+0x59/0xf0 remove_raw+0xb2/0x170dm_btree_remove+0xf4/0x1c0 dm_pool_delete_thin_device+0xc3/0x140pool_message+0x218/0x2b0 target_message+0x251/0x290 ctl_ioctl+0x1c4/0x4d0dm_ctl_ioctl+0xe/0x20 __x64_sys_ioctl+0x7b/0xb0 do_syscall_64+0x40/0xb0entry_SYSCALL_64_after_hwframe+0x44/0xae Fixing it by only assign new_rootwhen removal succeeds

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47343` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-156-generic - 4.15.0-156.163
linux-image-4.15.0-156-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-156.163
linux-image-4.15.0-156-lowlatency - 4.15.0-156.163
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-156-generic - 4.15.0-156.163
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-156-lowlatency - 4.15.0-156.163
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-84-generic - 5.4.0-84.94~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-84-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-84.94~18.04.1

No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-1069-fips - 4.15.0-1069.78
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2053-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2053.55

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-156.163').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-84.94~18.04.1').
linux-kvm package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1099.101').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1111.118').

linux-aws-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1056.59~18.04.1').
